title: Chinese Government provides RMB 100 million interest-free loan for National Performing Arts Theater Project (Linked to Project ID#33230)
description: On January 1, 2004, Chinese Government and the Government of Sri Lanka signed a $7,263,139 grant agreement for the National Performing Arts Theater Project (captured via Project ID#33230). Then, on July 8, 2004, the Chinese Government and the Government of Sri Lanka signed an RMB 100 million ($10,857,433) interest-free loan agreement for the National Performing Arts Theater Project (captured via Project ID#71571). The loan proceeds were drawn from three Economic and Technical Cooperation Agreements (ETCAs) worth RMB 20 million, RMB 30 million, and RMB 50 million that were signed on February 23, 2000, July 30, 2022, and February 11, 2003, respectively. This loan achieved a 100% disbursement rate. Its amount outstanding was RMB 100 million as of June 30, 2022.   The objective of the project was to construct a well-equipped modern theater in Colombo. The Nelum Pokuna Mahinda Rajapaksa Theatre (Sinhala: නෙළුම් පොකුණ මහින්ද රාජපක්ෂ රඟහල) — now known as Nelum Pokuna and previously known as the National Performing Arts Theatre — is a performing arts centre in Colombo, Sri Lanka.   Yanjian Group was the contractor responsible for project implementation. Its construction began on May 23, 2008. The theatre opened on December 15, 2011. The building spreads over 14,000 square meters of floor area. The theatre is equipped with ultra-modern facilities such as an auditorium with 1,288 seats, a library, and training facilities. The building features two permanent theaters—the main auditorium and an open-air theatre—and the ability to convert the front steps into an additional open-air theatre. The 690-square-meter moving stage in the auditorium includes the ability to raise and lower the orchestra pit to and from stage level. There are facilities to conduct educational and research activities. Parking for 500 vehicles is also available.
staff_comments: 1. The Chinese project title is 斯里兰卡国家艺术剧院. 2. The maturity length and grace period of the interest-free loan from MOFCOM are unknown. For the time being, AidData assumes standard MOFCOM interest-free loan borrowing terms (20-year maturity and 10-year grace period). 3. The Government of Sri Lanka loan key numbers (corresponding to the 3 ETCAs) are 2000073, 2002076, and 2003077.

title: CNPC provides $10 million USD grant for Merowe Bridge Construction Project
description: On 13 May 2004, the China National Petroleum Corporation (CNPC) signed an agreement granting the Government of Sudan $10 million USD to construct the Merowe Bridge (also called the Merowe Friendship Bridge or the Sudanese-Chinese friendship bridge) across the Nile River towards Aswan Dam. The purpose of this grant was to finance 50% of total project costs equal to$20 million USD.  The 440-meter-long and 20-meter-wide bridge links Merowe on the eastern bank of the Nile River to Karima on the other side. Construction of the bridge, which started in May 2004, was implemented by Jilin Province International Economic and Technical Corporation. The bridge was formally complete on 31 December 2007, and opened to traffic on 17 January 2008.

title: Poly Technologies Inc. provides $12 million USD supplier's credit for Ruffa Bridge Construction Project
description: On 4 August 2004, Poly Technologies Inc. (保利集团) provided a $12 million USD supplier's credit to the Government of Sudan for the Ruffa Bridge Construction Project. The loan terms are unknown. From this loan, $3 million USD was disbursed in 2007 and 7.4 million USD was disbursed in 2008. The World Bank identifies the total project cost to be $23 million USD.  This project involved the construction of a bridge that it 394 meters long and 11 meters wide. The bridge is located 130 kilometers south of Khartoum in Gezira (Al Jazirah) State. It crosses the Blue Nile River and connects the cities of Ruffa (رفاعة) and Al Hasahisa. Poly Technologies Inc. and China Railway 18th Bureau Group Co. title: Harbin Electric Company provides $82 million supplier's credit for Phase II of 212MW El-Jaili (Garri/Qarre) Gas Power Plant Construction Project (Linked to Project ID#158, #55858)
description: In March 2004, Harbin Electric International Company Limited (HEC; formerly known as Harbin Power Equipment Co. Ltd. or HPEC) signed an $82 million supplier's credit agreement with the Sudan National Electricity Corporation (NEC) for Phase II of the 212MW El-Jaili (Garri/Qarre) Gas Power Plant Construction Project. The borrowing terms of the loan are unknown. However, it is known that the loan was collateralized against oil receipts and China Export & Credit Insurance Corporation (Sinosure) provided credit insurance.  This project involved the installation of 4 gas turbines, 4 heat boilers, and 2 steam turbines with a total power generation of 200,000 kilowatts at the El-Jaili (Garri/Qarre) Gas Power Plant located about 80 km north of Khartoum.   Harbin Electric Company Limited was the contractor responsible for implementation. The first gas turbine was connected to the national electricity grid on January 29, 2007.  Then, on January 5, 2009, Sudan's President Omar Hassan Al Bashir, the Chinese Foreign Minister, and other Sudanese government officials opened the Garri (Qarre) I and II power stations.  Together, the power stations added 300 megawatts to the national grid.
